articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jack Queen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: The judge overseeing Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial will decide on Tuesday whether the former U.S. president should be punished for violating a gag order that prevents him from criticizing witnesses and others involved in the case.
articles.title: Judge to consider gag order violations in Trump hush money trial

articles.author: Mike Stone, Steve Holland
articles.description: The United States is preparing a $1 billion military aid package for Ukraine, the first to be sourced from the yet to be signed Ukraine-Israel bill, two U.S. officials told Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: US preparing $1 billion weapons package for Ukraine, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least five migrants died in an attempt to cross the English Channel from an area near the French town of Wimereux on Tuesday, police said.
articles.title: At least five migrants die in attempt to cross English Channel, French police says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel bombarded northern Gaza overnight in some of the heaviest shelling in weeks, panicking residents and flattening neighbourhoods in an area where the Israeli army had previously drawn down its troops, residents said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel military strikes northern Gaza in heaviest shelling in weeks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli attack on Iranian territory could radically change dynamics and result in there being nothing left of the "Zionist regime", Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi was quoted as saying on Tuesday by the official IRNA news agency.
articles.title: Iran threatens to annihilate Israel should it launch a major attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.N. rights chief Volker Turk said on Tuesday that he was "horrified" by the destruction of the Nasser and Al Shifa medical facilities in Gaza and reports of mass graves containing hundreds of bodies there, according to a spokesperson.
articles.title: UN rights chief 'horrified' by mass grave reports at Gaza hospitals

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Far from the trenches, at orderly new centres across Ukraine, civilian recruiters armed with laptops and info packs offer patriotic volunteers opportunities to join the war.
articles.title: Ukraine launches military charm offensive as conscription flags

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian court on Tuesday rejected the latest in a series of appeals by Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich against his pre-trial detention on charges of espionage.
articles.title: Russian court rejects new appeal by US reporter Evan Gershkovich

articles.author: Rajesh Prabhuswamy, Rupam Jain
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his Hindu nationalist party have begun attacking opposition rivals, saying they favour minority Muslims, in what analysts see as a bid to invigorate their hardline base after general elections began last week.
articles.title: India's Modi calls rivals pro-Muslim as election campaign changes tack

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Omar Assad's 81-year-old widow still hopes to see justice served against the Israeli soldiers she blames for his death two years ago in the occupied West Bank, but isn't pinning hope on any action the United States might take against their battalion.
articles.title: Widowed Palestinian doesn't expect much from US action against Israel
